text: If you meant overall article time, Kenny's advice is pretty good. Andy Crestodina shares a great practice here too: <https://www.orbitmedia.com/blog/how-to-write-a-blog-post/>

attachments.title: How to Write a Blog Post for SEO: High-Speed Video Shows Process | Orbit Media Studios
attachments.text: Do you want to write a post that ranks? Are you writing for SEO? Ever wonder how to write a better blog post for top of funnel visibility? I recorded myself writing a high-ranking post. This high-speed video shows you how to do it yourself.
attachments.fallback: Orbit Media Studios: How to Write a Blog Post for SEO: High-Speed Video Shows Process | Orbit Media Studios

^^^Key point in article above is that it takes him a week to get expert quotes b/c of time to reach out, etc.

It all depends on the post. Most good research will take longer than a day unless that is your sole focus

text:
imo If you want to improve your writing speed, nothing beats writing more. Write every day and build a habit—it trains your brain to let the words flow more easily to the page, without overthinking it.

That said, the above advice is great for building a system for writing, which can definitely help you produce more in less time.

elements.text:

That said, the above advice is great for building a system for writing, which can definitely help you produce more in less time.

text: Like <@UMFSZ8JHL> mentioned, it's about getting the words out. Since I tend to get stuck on intro sections and certain areas of my landing pages, I give myself a strict time limit (e.g. 8 minutes) for those areas, at least for the first draft. I don't always finish in the time allotted, but it speed me up.

text:
Some inspiration and insight to share with y'all (in the form of a content hub case study)! :slightly_smiling_face: Interested in learning how Cloudflare ranks for nearly 8,000 highly searched keywords in the span of 32 webpages?

- 7,800+ keywords ranking
- variety of rich results / serp features
- 658 kws rank in top 3 results (1,594 on page 1)

I'm publishing a series of posts/case study about this content strategy and how hubs/pillars can give massive roi. Quite a lot to unpack and analyze, so it's split into parts - part 1 focuses on SEO and keywords of Cloudflare's DNS Content Hub.

Dig into the data and let me know what you think: <https://scottmathson.com/blog/2020/04/23/cloudflare-dns-content-hub-case-study-pt-1-seo-rankings/>

attachments.title: Cloudflare's DNS Content Hub - Part 1: SEO (8.0K keywords)
attachments.text: Check out this SEO case study series to learn how Cloudflare's DNS content hub of 32 pages ranks for 8,000 highly searched keywords in many countries. 658 kws in the Top 3, 1,594 ranking on page 1 - check it out!
attachments.fallback: Scott Mathson: Cloudflare's DNS Content Hub - Part 1: SEO (8.0K keywords)

text:
These are all really helpful tips. I would add watching your distractions and noticing where you're losing time from writing because [fill-in-the-blank].

When I don't want to write or feel ineffective, I tend to let distractions get the best of me. So maybe having a "focus mode" routine that works for you (some ritual + 50 minute pomodoros, etc.)
